page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF HAREWOOD AREA
page.content: The area contains farm and woodland, bordering the River Wharfe.The settlements are mainly either small hamlets,like Dunkeswick,High and Low Weardley;commuting villages like Weeton or isolated houses.The buildings are mainly very old and of local stone like the Nunnery;the ruined castle of Harewood,and Harewood House itself. The land in the valley bottom is just below 125 metres,but it rises fairly steeply in the southern part of the area to over 300 metres at Rawden Hill and the site of Harewood House. Harewood House,the old Home Farm and the Harewood Park cover a quarter of this area.The major roads,the only form of communication,are the A61, Leeds-Harrogate and the A659,Otley- Harrogate.
